attributes.action: Prioritise vulnerable Afghan minorities for UK refugee resettlement programme
attributes.additional_details: The government must prioritise at risk minorities for the UK refugee resettlement programme. We must take as many Afghan minorities as possible.
attributes.background:
These minorities including Hazaras, Sikhs and Hindus are at particular risk from the Taliban onslaught.
The Taliban have already targeted and massacred members of the Hazara minority. This group is at most risk as the victim of ethnic cleansing.

rejection.details:
The Home Office announced on 18 August 2021 a bespoke resettlement route for Afghan refugees who have been forced to flee the country and has said that it is committed to providing protection for vulnerable people fleeing Afghanistan. You can read more about it on the gov.uk website: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/bespoke-resettlement-route-for-afghan-refugees-announced

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help the people of Afghanistan: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594723

Redeploy UK Forces to Afghanistan to protect the citizens against the Taliban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594823
